% This file contains sea ice cover data used in Eisenman et al. (2014).
% 
% The file contains monthly-mean values of Southern Hemisphere ice area and ice
% extent generated from Bootstrap Version 1 (v1) and Bootstrap Version 2 (v2)
% daily ice concentration fields. The v2 daily ice concentration fields were
% downloaded from http://nsidc.org/data/nsidc-0079, the v1 daily ice concentration
% fields were acquired by request from NSIDC User Services (who gave me permission
% to share our processed version of this data), and our computation of ice extent
% and ice area from these fields is outlined in Sec. 2 of the paper and described
% in more detail in Sec. S1 of the paper's Supplement. Note that this v1 dataset
% ends in 12/2004 (values after this are given as NaN in the table below), and
% this v2 dataset ends in 12/2012.
% 
% The columns are as follows: (1) year, (2) month, (3) v1 ice extent,
% (4) v2 ice extent, (5) v1 ice area, (6) v2 ice area.
% 
% Please feel free contact me with any questions, etc:
% Ian Eisenman <eisenman@ucsd.edu>
% 
% Reference: Eisenman, Meier, and Norris (2014). A spurious jump in the satellite
% record: has Antarctic sea ice expansion been overestimated?  The Cryosphere 8, 
% 1289-1296.
% 
1978	11	16.742	15.845	13.271	13.1
1978	12	11.267	10.529	7.8124	7.8584
1979	1	6.0753	5.5183	3.8168	3.8436
